law.catch_line: Ordering of challengers from polling places.

text.section: It shall be the duty of a precinct election officer to warn a challenger who violates any provision of KRS 117.187 and 117.316 to 117.318. If the challenger continues to violate these provisions, the precinct election officer shall order the challenger out of the polling place. Any challenger ordered from the polling place shall be prohibited from acting as a challenger in any precinct in any election for a period of five (5) years.
The provisions of KRS 117.187 and 117.316 to 117.318 shall apply to all challengers in all elections conducted in the Commonwealth.

law.history: Created 1992 Ky. Acts ch. 288, sec. 53, effective July 14, 1992.
